intro: Eriandra fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant eriandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
